instructions: Fry the onion for a long time until it becomes golden and caramelized.
Add the tomato paste and cook for an extended period, allowing the flavors to meld.
Slice the sausages and add them to the mixture.
Season with paprika, salt, and black pepper to taste.
Crack the eggs into the pan, trying to keep some of the yolks intact.
notes: This dish is a beloved variation of shakshuka, featuring long-fried onions that add a rich sweetness to the tomato base. It is often enjoyed as a hearty breakfast or brunch.
